intro: Boronia artemisioides, commonly known as the silverleaf boronia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in heathlands and rocky soils, preferring well-drained conditions. Boronia artemisioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and distinctive fragrance.
